PatchGeometryFactory#

Module Contents#

Classes#

PatchGeometryFactory

This class constructs the grid layout of the stimulus patch in correspondence with PING networks by applying the
class PatchGeometryFactory.PatchGeometryFactory#

This class constructs the grid layout of the stimulus patch in correspondence with PING networks by applying the lattice.

create(self, nr_ping_networks: int, stimulus_patch: numpy.ndarray[int, int, float], patch_start: tuple[int, int], stimulus_center: tuple[float, float], atopix: float) → src.PatchGeometry.PatchGeometry#

Goes through the steps to construct a PING grid out of the stimulus.

Parameters

  • nr_ping_networks (int) – number of PING networks.

  • stimulus_patch (numpy.ndarray[(int, int), float]) – the luminance matrix of a patch of the stimulus.

  • patch_start (tuple[int, int]) – top left coordinate of the patch.

  • stimulus_center (tuple[float, float]) – the center of the full stimulus.

  • atopix (float) – conversion coefficient between pixels and visual degrees.

Returns

the layout (geometry) of the patch.

Return type

PatchGeometry

_assign_circuits(self, nr_ping_networks: int, stimulus_patch: numpy.ndarray[int, int, float], atopix: float) → list[src.PatchGeometry.PINGNetworkPixels]#

Creates circuits and assigns centers and pixels of the stimulus patch to them.

Parameters

  • nr_ping_networks (int) – number of PING networks.

  • stimulus_patch (numpy.ndarray[(int, int), float]) – the luminance matrix of a patch of the stimulus.

  • atopix (float) – conversion coefficient between pixels and visual degrees.

Returns

list of all PING networks of the stimulus patch created by applying a lattice.

Return type

list[PINGNetworkPixels]
